repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
## Summary

Add optional `{ buf = N }` parameter to `nvim_list_chans()` to filter channels by terminal buffer. This follows the pattern planned for all "get" APIs.

- Add `Dict(list_chans)` keyset with optional `buf` field
- Update `channel_all_info()` to accept filter parameter
- Update existing test cases to pass empty dict `{}` (required by new signature)

## Example

```lua
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('TermOpen', {
  callback = function(ev)
    local chans = vim.api.nvim_list_chans({ buf = ev.buf })
    if chans[1] and #chans[1].argv <= 1 then
      vim.cmd('startinsert')
    end
  end
})
```

## Test plan

- [x] Added test for `{ buf = N }` filter in vim_spec.lua
- [x] Updated existing tests to use `nvim_list_chans({})` 
- [x] All functional tests pass

Ref #36678

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +144,7 @@ NEW FEATURES
 The following new features were added.
 
 • API:
-  • Passing 0 to |nvim_get_chan_info()| gets info about the current channel.
+  • Passing 0 to `nvim_get_chan_info()` gets info about the current channel.

comment_data.body:
I don't think `|nvim_chan_get()|` should be used here. It doesn't exist in v0.10. Instead just change this to:
```suggestion
  • Passing 0 to `nvim_get_chan_info()` gets info about the current channel.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +144,7 @@ NEW FEATURES
 The following new features were added.
 
 • API:
-  • Passing 0 to |nvim_get_chan_info()| gets info about the current channel.
+  • |nvim_chan_get()| with `id=0` gets info about the current channel.

comment_data.body: Shouldn't `nvim_get_chan_info` still be mentioned in deprecated.txt and thus still have a valid tag?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -144,7 +144,7 @@ NEW FEATURES
 The following new features were added.
 
 • API:
-  • Passing 0 to |nvim_get_chan_info()| gets info about the current channel.
+  • |nvim_chan_get()| with `id=0` gets info about the current channel.

comment_regular_data.body: I think changing `nvim_list_chans` this way violates the current `:h api-contract`, at least until #31903 is implemented.

I missed that while the api-contract allows adding an optional `opts` parameter, the current implementation actually requires passing `{}` at the call site - making this a breaking change.

I see #31903 tracks making `opts` truly optional, but it's not implemented yet.

How would you suggest proceeding here? Should I wait for #31903, or take a different approach?

Historically we'd introduce something like `nvim_list_chans2` and deprecate the old one, but with #31903 open it's probably better to wait for that to be addressed instead.

Open PR #33392 exists to relax `opts`, but seems stalled; feel free to take over that work if you're up to it.

In any case, I'll ping @justinmk for his opinion. :pray:

See this command by Justin: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/27195#pullrequestreview-1847670314 and the relevant docs in `:help dev-naming`:

> get: Gets things. Two variants (overloads): 1. `get<T>(id: int): T` returns one item. 2. `get<T>(filter: dict): T[]` returns a list.

> Do NOT use these deprecated verbs:
> - ...
> - list: Redundant with "get"

Thus creating a `nvim_chan_get` function and deprecating `nvim_get_chan_info` and `nvim_list_chans` seems like the better approach. Justin proposed the signature `nvim_chan_get(id, opts)`, however, I would go with just `nvim_chan_get(opts)` and have `id` be one of the keys in `opts`, similar to `nvim_get_autocmds()`.

Nice! Yes, #33392 is needed for cases where we want to extend an existing function, but since this PR eliminates 2 functions which don't really have a reason to be separate, and it improves the naming, I think we should go with this.


Probably should move the old tests to `test/functional/api/deprecated_spec.lua` . And copy relevant tests for the new API.

> Justin proposed the signature `nvim_chan_get(id, opts)`, however, I would go with just `nvim_chan_get(opts)` and have `id` be one of the keys in `opts`

That's a good instinct, but for get-by-id the `id` arg makes sense to avoid "table allocation" which is commonly desired. (Side-note: `opts={}` is currently required when calling from Lua, but after #33392 it will be optional so `opts=nil` will work).

@justinmk Thanks for the feedback on moving `id` to a first parameter!

Before I refactor, I'd like to clarify the design for "get all channels":

**Proposed signature:** `nvim_chan_get(chan, opts)`

**Design question:** If `chan` is a required first parameter, what should `chan=0` mean?

| Option | `chan=0` means | "Get all" via | Trade-off |
|--------|----------------|---------------|-----------|
| A | All channels | `nvim_chan_get(0, {})` | Clean, but loses "current channel" shorthand |
| B | Current channel | Need special value like `-1` or `nil` | Backward compat, but `-1` is ugly |

The current PR uses option A's logic but with `id` inside opts, which lets us distinguish "no filter" (`{}`) from "current channel" (`{id=0}`).

Which approach do you prefer? Happy to refactor either way.

The failing test (`vim.pack add() startup works in plugin/` in `pack_spec.lua`) appears to be unrelated to the changes in this PR. The error is a module loading issue (`module 'plugindirs' not found`) in the `vim.pack` plugin system, which has no connection to the channel API changes here.

This failure only occurred on the macOS Intel runner while all other CI jobs passed, suggesting it may be a flaky test or transient CI environment issue. The master branch CI is currently green with the same test passing.

Happy to re-run the CI if needed.
This PR is probably too heavy on the LLM side. I close this until either me or Claude Code is in a better position to contribute in a valuable way.

title: feat(api): add buf filter to nvim_list_chans()
